page.title: 08The Great Globe
page.content: Leading down the south side of Durlston Castle is a footpath to the "Great Globe". It is a scale model of the world made from Portland stone. Positioned on a south facing slope, it commands excellent south and east facing views of the English Channel. The Globe weighs 40 tons and is made up of 15 separate pieces. It was made in Greenwich, London, in 1889, and took 2 years to build. It was transported to Durlston in 1891,where it took two months to assemble. The Globe is surrounded by an iron fence and twelve London street bollards. Eight stone seats marking compass points surround the Globe.
